etymology.description: Depicts a drum 壴, with a base and feathers 土 on top -> stylized in the Kangxi radical 鼓
etymology.interpretation: The character 壴(壴) (zhù, "drum") visually represents a drum with two ends, with elements contributing to its structure, such as a base and feathers. It was later incorporated into characters like 鼓(鼓) (gǔ, "drum") by adding elements that illustrate additional actions like hands holding a drumstick.

examples.chinese: 这面壴声震天动地(這面壴聲震天動地)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè miàn zhù shēng zhèn tiān dòng dì.
examples.english: The sound of this drum shakes the heavens and the earth.

examples.chinese: 战士敲响壴(戰士敲響壴)，示警敌人(示警敵人)。
examples.pinyin: Zhànshì qiāo xiǎng zhù, shì jǐng dírén.
examples.english: The soldier beats the drum to warn the enemy.

examples.chinese: 庄严仪式上(莊嚴儀式上)，祭司击打壴(祭司擊打壴)，宣告传统(宣告傳統)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuāngyán yíshì shàng, jìsī jī dǎ zhù, xuānguò chuántǒng.
examples.english: At the solemn ceremony, the priest beats the drum to proclaim tradition.
